bibl.title: Despatch from Owen L. W. Smith to David J. Hill, March 24, 1899
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

correspAction.roleName: U.S. Minister Resident and Consul General

p.add: ACKNOWLEDGED MAY 11 1899 Bureau of Foreign Commerce.

div1.p: No. 25, Consular Series. Legation of the United States, Monrovia Liberia, March 24, 1899.

p.add: INDEX BUREAU REC'D MAY 2 '99 DEPT OF STATE

div1.p: Owen L. W. Smith to Hon. David J. Hill, Assistant Secretary of State, Washington.

Sir: I have the honor to transmit, herewith, a supplemental, statistical report, relative to the Cape Coast Castle Consular Agency. This supplemental report, recors the last 3 quarters of 1897, including all of the 1898 and January of 1899.
In submitting, a partial, statistical report of the Republic of Liberia, in my "Consular," dispatch of Oct. 7, 1898. I referred

referred to the impracticability of giving a full report before the ssemblying of the Legislature in December 1898; and promised to send a supplemental report after that date. I have to inform you that we have made several efforts to obtain the desired information, but have in every case been told by the Camptroller, that it could not be furnished, as he was not in possession of same.
I have the honor to be your obedient servant; Owen L. W. Smith M. R. and C. General.
Inclosure.
No. 1143/99. In case of reply the number and date of this letter should be quoted.
Colonial Secretary's Office. Accra.__ Gold COast. 2nd March 1899.
Sir, I am directed by His Excellency the Acting Governor to acknowledge your letter of the 14th ultimo, and beg to forward you a tabulated statement giving the information you ask for.
I am, Sir, Your obedient Servant, G. A. Haddon Smith Acting Colonial Secretary
L. W. SMITH, ESQRE. INISTER RESIDENT & CONSUL GENERAL OF THE UNITED STATES TO LIBERIA, UNITED STATE'S LEGATION. MONROVIA, LIBERIA.
Tonnage, value of imports to, and exports, from the colony for the United States since the 30th June 1897 to February 1899.
Name of Vessel Tonnage Date of arrival in the Colony Date of departure from the Colony Value of Imports into the Colony Value of Eschorts from the Colony for the United States. Remarks.
